analysis.Summary: Vue 3 component that renders a form for configuring automatic product reorder settings (threshold, quantity, notifications, auto-order) and emits events to save or cancel.
analysis.Purpose: To provide a reusable UI for viewing and editing reorder-related parameters for a given product and communicating those settings back to a parent component.

Components.name: ReorderSettingsForm
Components.responsibility: Host component that manages form state, handles user interaction, and emits save/close events.

Components.name: Field
Components.responsibility: Wrapped input component (type=number) used for entering the reorder threshold and quantity.

Components.name: Checkbox
Components.responsibility: Wrapped checkbox component used for toggling notification channels and automatic order creation.

Functions.name: saveSettings
Functions.description: Collects current form values, normalizes them (parsing numbers, reading booleans), and emits a 'save' event with the assembled settings object.

analysis.Usage: Imported into a parent view or modal via `import ReorderSettingsForm from 'modules/products/components/forms/ReorderSettingsForm.vue'`. The parent passes a `product` prop and listens for `@save="..."` and `@close="..."` to handle user actions.
Notes: Initial values for threshold and quantity default to strings ('5' and '10') if no product prop is provided.
Uses Vue 3 `<script setup>` syntax and v-model modifiers (`v-model:field`, `v-model:checked`).
Numeric inputs are parsed with `parseInt(..., 10)` with fallback defaults.
No dedicated `<style>` sectionâ€”relies on utility classes (`mn-b-medium`, `pd-small`, etc.) from the project's design system.
Auto-order toggle default is `false`, notifications defaults to `{ email: true, push: false, system: true }`.
